abstract: China said it had evidence showing that for at least six years, employees working for the British-Australian mining giant Rio Tinto engaged in commercial espionage, costing the country about $100 billion.
snippet: China said it had evidence showing that for at least six years, employees working for the British-Australian mining giant Rio Tinto engaged in commercial espionage, costing the country about $100 billion.
lead_paragraph: China said Sunday that it had evidence showing that for at least six years, employees working for the British-Australian mining giant Rio Tinto engaged in commercial espionage, costing the country about $100 billion, David Barboza reported in The New York Times.

headline.main: China Says $100 Billion Was Bilked by Rio Tinto
